column4: hallo, I like to do telnet connection from one Beezy PC to another one. I get "connection refused". How can I allow the connection??
do you have telnetd running on the server?
I do not, because I use only ssh normaly.
yea, well, then it cant work ;)
install telnetd then
It is not the real problem.
I have on one PC a software license server over UDP running. The client should connect over the port 56797? But they cant contakt.
So I used the telnet to test the connection
telnet used tcp
uses
What is the reason for "connection refused" in a LAN??
it just means that telnet cant connect to the port
because your server listens on a udp port but telnet tries to connecnt to tcp
how can I open the port ?
The client can not connect to the UDP port ? How can I allow it ??
do you have a firewall running?
Only on the router, not in the interLAN
Only on the router, not in the interLAN
you can try and tcpdump to see if the packages arrive
and use netstat to check if the server is really listening on the port its supposed to be
how is the command to check a speciffic port ?
